meanings.definition: A division or part of a whole
meanings.sent1: The cake was cut into a small div for each guest.
meanings.sent2: The book is divided into chapters, with each chapter being a div.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were fighting over who gets to be the last div.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, each tree stood as a div in the vast green sea.
meanings.sent5: The div in the necklace represented the bond between the two friends.

meanings.definition: A person considered unpleasant or disagreeable
meanings.sent1: The div at the party kept complaining about everything.
meanings.sent2: She always avoids sitting next to the div in her class.
meanings.sent3: The div's grumpy face made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was like a div, always finding faults in her work.
meanings.sent5: The div's negative attitude brought down the mood of the whole group.

meanings.definition: To separate or split into parts
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to div the cake into equal slices.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to div into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: He tried to div the argument into smaller, more manageable points.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to div the land in half as it flowed through.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to div a single rope into two separate pieces.
